body_html:
@poxvoculi I tried the following:

    # prevent errors from being printed for hours when memory runs out
    # https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/20998
    config = tf.ConfigProto()
    config.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
    config.report_tensor_allocations_upon_oom = False
    # config.inter_op_parallelism_threads = 40
    tf_session = tf.Session(config=config)
    K.set_session(tf_session)

And got this error:

Using TensorFlow backend.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "cornell_hyperopt.py", line 149, in <module>
    tf.app.run(main=main)
  File "/home/ahundt/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/platform/app.py", line 126, in run
    _sys.exit(main(argv))
  File "cornell_hyperopt.py", line 68, in main
    config.report_tensor_allocations_upon_oom = False
AttributeError: Assignment not allowed (no field "report_tensor_allocations_upon_oom" in protocol message object).

body:
@poxvoculi I tried the following:
```python
    # prevent errors from being printed for hours when memory runs out
    # https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/20998
    config = tf.ConfigProto()
    config.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
    config.report_tensor_allocations_upon_oom = False
    # config.inter_op_parallelism_threads = 40
    tf_session = tf.Session(config=config)
    K.set_session(tf_session)
```
And got this error:
```
Using TensorFlow backend.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "cornell_hyperopt.py", line 149, in <module>
    tf.app.run(main=main)
  File "/home/ahundt/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/platform/app.py", line 126, in run
    _sys.exit(main(argv))
  File "cornell_hyperopt.py", line 68, in main
    config.report_tensor_allocations_upon_oom = False
AttributeError: Assignment not allowed (no field "report_tensor_allocations_upon_oom" in protocol message object).
```
